subStages.name: Organize Sprint Deliverables
content: Compile list of completed user stories and features
Prepare demonstrations of working software
Ensure all demo environments are set up and functional
Create or update any necessary presentation materials

subStages.name: Invite Stakeholders
content: Identify key stakeholders to attend the review
Send out invitations with meeting details
Include agenda and objectives of the sprint review
Confirm attendance and manage any scheduling conflicts

subStages.name: Review Sprint Metrics
content: Analyze sprint burndown/burnup chart
Calculate velocity and compare to previous sprints
Compile list of completed vs. planned work
Prepare to discuss any significant deviations from the plan

subStages.name: Brief the Team
content: Hold a pre-review meeting with the development team
Assign roles for the sprint review (e.g., who will demo what)
Review key points to be communicated to stakeholders
Prepare team for potential questions or feedback

subStages.name: Set the Stage
content: Welcome attendees and introduce the team
Review the agenda and objectives of the meeting
Recap the sprint goal and planned deliverables
Explain the format of the review and how feedback will be collected

subStages.name: Present Sprint Results
content: Showcase completed user stories and features
Demonstrate working software or product increments
Highlight any technical achievements or innovations
Present relevant sprint metrics and performance data

subStages.name: Gather Feedback
content: Encourage stakeholders to ask questions and provide feedback
Discuss any features that didn't meet expectations
Capture suggestions for improvements or modifications
Note any new ideas or requirements that emerge from the discussion

subStages.name: Review Product Backlog
content: Discuss how the sprint outcomes affect the overall product backlog
Review upcoming features and priorities
Consider any necessary adjustments to the product roadmap
Identify potential items for the next sprint

subStages.name: Discuss Unfinished Items
content: Review any sprint backlog items that weren't completed
Explain reasons for incomplete work
Discuss impact on overall project timeline and goals
Decide whether to carry over items to the next sprint or return them to the product backlog

subStages.name: Identify Blockers and Challenges
content: Highlight any significant obstacles encountered during the sprint
Discuss ongoing challenges that may affect future sprints
Brainstorm potential solutions or mitigations
Assign action items for addressing key blockers

subStages.name: Adjust Expectations
content: If necessary, revise estimates for remaining work
Update stakeholders on any changes to the expected delivery timeline
Discuss any scope adjustments that may be required
Ensure alignment between stakeholder expectations and team capacity

subStages.name: Plan Follow-up Actions
content: Create action items for any critical issues or feedback
Assign owners and deadlines for follow-up tasks
Schedule any necessary additional meetings or discussions
Ensure all action items are documented and tracked

subStages.name: Summarize Key Outcomes
content: Recap the main achievements of the sprint
Highlight key decisions made during the review
Summarize critical feedback received
Restate any significant changes to the product backlog or roadmap

subStages.name: Acknowledge Team Efforts
content: Recognize the team's hard work and accomplishments
Highlight any exceptional contributions or problem-solving
Thank stakeholders for their participation and input
Reinforce the collaborative nature of the Agile process

subStages.name: Set Expectations for Next Steps
content: Briefly preview the upcoming sprint planning session
Mention any immediate action items or follow-ups
Remind team of the upcoming sprint retrospective
Confirm the tentative date for the next sprint review

subStages.name: Document Review Outcomes
content: Compile notes and key points from the review
Update sprint and product documentation as needed
Distribute summary of the sprint review to relevant stakeholders
Ensure all action items and decisions are properly recorded
